poem:
### Silences in Protest

In the paper's folds,  
a million voices mute,  
hands lifted in silent protest,  
like shadows on the grass.  
Yet the ink bleeds apathy,  
a yawn in headline form.  
The quiet march on,  
their whispers gathering,  
an undercurrent of change  
in a world forgetting  
how to listen.
